articles.title: Sri Lanka stumbles towards its first default on foreign debt
articles.description: ​​The island nation could be formally declared in default if it fails to make an interest payment to bondholders before Wednesday, when the 30-day grace period for missed coupons on dollar bonds ends. That would mark its first default.
articles.content:
Sri Lanka is sliding inexorably into default as the grace period on two unpaid foreign bonds nears an end, the latest blow to a country rattled by economic pain and social unrest.

articles.description: Shares of ACC and Ambuja Cements were in huge demand on Monday after Gautam Adani's group clinched a deal to acquire a controlling stake in Holcim Ltd's businesses in India for $10.5 billion. The stock of ACC rallied 7.79 per cent to Rs 2,288.15 on the BSE.
